Animal Name: Jaguar
Scientific Name: Panthera onca
Conservation Status: Near Threatened
Habitats: Forests, Grasslands
Countries: Mexico to Argentina across 18 countries
Summary: The jaguar is a large cat species and the only living member of the genus Panthera native to the Americas. It is the largest cat species in the Americas and the third largest in the world. Jaguars are strictly carnivorous and are considered opportunistic hunters, meaning they will prey on almost any animal that crosses their path. Their habitats include wet and dry forests, savannahs, and shrublands.
